message.content:
Step 1: Determine the age difference between you and your sister when you were both younger.
If you were 6 years old and your sister was half your age, that means she was 6 / 2 = 3 years old at that time.

Step 2: Calculate how many years have passed since then.
Now you are 80 years old, so the number of years that have passed is 80 - 6 = 74 years.

Step 3: Add the age difference from Step 1 to the current age of your sister.
Since there was a 3-year age difference and 74 years have passed, your sister's age would now be 3 + 74 = 77 years old.
